isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: The removal of e tilt cab from the chassis can be performed providing an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture is available. Cab removal procedure may vary for various models depending on the type of equipment and accessories which are installed on chassis and cab. The following steps can be used as a guide for cab removal:
Refer to the appropriate section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for proper procedures.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Block wheels of vehicle and set parking brake.
Drain radiator and air system.

Tilt cab forward and engage cylinder safety prop. Refer to CAB TILTING, PROCEDURE
.
Discharge air conditioning system and disconnect system lines, if so equipped.
Disconnect battery ground cable.
Remove steering gear universal joint at steering gear.
Disconnect accelerator linkage and cruise control, if so equipped.
Disconnect wiring harness from connectors under cab right floor panel and all other wiring leading from the chassis or engine into the cab.
Disconnect heater hoses.
Disconnect clutch.
Disconnect engine shut-off control cable.
Disconnect brake air lines and hoses.
Detach any other accessory between cab and frame.
Install cab lifting fixture to cab and secure fixture to lifting hoist.
With cab weight on lifting fixture, proceed as follows:

step2.para: Detach cab lift cylinders from cab.
Position cylinder safety prop in traveling position.
Remove cab front mounting hinge pins.
Remove cab and lower cab to the floor. Remove lifting hoist from cab lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: The following steps can be used as a guide for cab installation. Refer to the appropriate section in the CTS- 5000 Master Service Manual for proper procedures.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing the cab on the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: With cab secured to lifting fixture and hoist, proceed as follows:

step2.para: Position cab on chassis and install cab front mounting hinge pins.
Install cab lift cylinders to cab.
Place cylinder safety prop in engaged position.
Remove cab lifting fixture from cab.

step1.para: Connect brake air lines and hoses.
Connect engine shut-off control cable.
Connect clutch.
Connect heater hoses.
Connect wiring harness from connectors under cab right floor panel and all other wiring leading from the chassis or engine into the cab.
Connect accelerator linkage and cruise control, if so equipped.
Install steering gear universal joint at steering gear.
Connect battery ground cable.
Fill radiator and close air tank valves.
Connect A/C lines and charge system, if applicable.
Charge air tanks, then check air system, radiator and A/C system connections for leaks.

Lower, raise and lower cab to check operation. Refer to CAB TILTING, PROCEDURE, Lower Cab
.
Road test vehicle for proper operation.
